Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s first entry into that particular camp called ‘Night Of The Living Dead’ spawned nine additional movies, as well as several popular theatrical sequels by other filmmakers. The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that an ancient evil is with them. Just when you think it can’t get worse than that group has to battle against possible desert casualties and man-eating lions.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie was decent produced though.
That being said, as a piece of film history hate or love it it's importance and influence on future films can't be denied. If you ask anyone to name an old film I bet that "once upon a time" is part of their answer.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>
